description:
Exserohilum turcica Et28A is a strain of the fungal species Exserohilum turcica, which is a common plant pathogen that causes a disease known as northern corn leaf blight in maize and other cereal crops. The species Exserohilum turcica is classified within the phylum Ascomycota, class Dothideomycetes, and order Pleosporales.

The strain Et28A has been the subject of scientific research, likely due to its potential importance in agriculture or as a model organism for studying the biology and genetics of Exserohilum turcica. However, without more specific information about the research conducted on this particular strain, I cannot provide a more detailed scientific description beyond the general characteristics of the Exserohilum turcica species.
